answers.answer: Have they done bloodwork to check for diabetes?  A lot of times diabetes will cause weight LOSS instead of gain, but the constant hunger can be a symptom of the disease.I would definitely pursue the thyroid issue especially since it runs in the famly.  Maybe request an ultrasound of the thyroid and definitely request another round of the bloodwork.Is your daughter taking any other medications other than the Miralax?  the stomach pains could be related to the constipation - I know my stomach hurts a lot if I have trouble with it.I would also suggest having her tested for Gastric Reflux - the burping and pain in the neck could be symptoms of this, even if she doesn't complain of heartburn.  Again, reflux can cause stomach pain.  Meanwhile, I would try to eliminate anything carbonated if she drinks things like that - they can definitely add to gas/burping and also stomach pain.Have you also tried experimenting with her diet - elminating things like dairy or wheat products and seeing if that has any affect on her?  I had a milk allergy as a child and my main symptoms were abdominal pain and constipation.  If you do try to experiment with her diet - I would elminate those type of things first, then slowly add things back to see if you can determine what, if anything, triggers the problem.  I would only add back one item at a time, such as cheese, then wait a couple of days before adding back something else.  That way it should be easier to determine if anything causes changes.You could also request that your pediatrician recommend/refer you to a pediatric gastro doc and see if they have any other ideas/tests they could run.  More of a "specialist" like that might have better insight to things that a general pediatrician.I hope your daughter feels better soon!  Keep us posted.

Make sure your daughter sees aand Endocrinologist regarding her thyroid.  Our endocrine system impacts every organ of the body, An Endo will will also check for diabetes.  I hope she's already on medication as the thyroid obviously is not functioning properly.  The endocrine system can throw many thing out of whack so this is a good place to start. I also, recommend getting a pediatric Gastroenterologist involved.

question: I am at the end of my rope and can't get any answers for my daughter's symptoms.  She has been complaining for about 4 years of stomach pains but I just brushed it off to nerves because it was usually when we had to go to party or social event.  About two years ago I started noticing excessive belching and this would  last all night through her sleep.  She has sever constipation and she has been taking mirolax everyday.  About 6 months ago I noticed that she is constantly hungry (abnormally hungry) and she has gone from weighing 68 pds. a couple of months ago to 84 pds.  She complains her neck hurts when hungry.  We have had x-rays,stool samples analyzed,endoscopy, blood test for thyroid.  Her peditrician said the first test for thyroid that the t4 was low but tsh normal.  The 2nd one , the nurse just said everything was normal.  There is a history of thyroid issues on both side of family.  I am also thinking maybe she is bipolar because my mom was bipolar and she does exhibit some of the symptoms such as low to high mood swings.  Has anyone else been through any similar symptoms?  Thanks
title: 10 year old gaining excessive weight
